summary: This document is a series of official inmate count sheets and rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 6, 2019. It records the headcounts of inmates in various housing units and includes specific inmate assignments, notably for suicide watch and hospital care. The documents are procedural records from the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

events.title: Daily Inmate Count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine official inmate counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, across various housing units, recording a total inmate population.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 6, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.
The records show routine prison administrative procedures, including headcounts by housing unit and specific inmate assignments.
Inmate rosters list assignments including 'HOSP' (hospital) and 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' (suicide watch or unassigned), which are relevant given the circumstances of Epstein's death.
The total inmate count recorded across the facility was 759 individuals at one point during the count process.
The documents are standard Bureau of Prisons forms, indicating normal operations were being documented on the day of a major incident.
